example.context:
colearn[all]


To run stand-alone examples:

 python -m colearn_examples.ml_interface.run_demo


For more examples see the Examples Page

Installing From Source¶

Alternatively, to install the latest code from the repo:

Download the source code from github:
git clone https://github.com/fetchai/colearn.git && cd colearn

Create and launch a clean virtual environment with Python 3.7. (This library has currently only been tested with Python 3.7).
pipenv --python 3.7 && pipenv shell


Install the package from source:

pip install -e .[all]


Run one of the examples:

python colearn_examples/ml_interface/pytorch_mnist.py


If you are developing the colearn library then install it in editable mode so that new changes are effective immediately:

pip install -e .[all]

Running the tests¶

Tests can be run with:

tox

Documentation¶

To run the documentation, first install mkdocs and plugins:

pip install .[docs] 


Then run:

mkdocs serve

interactions.input: How do you install colearn from source?
interactions.response: To install colearn from source, first download the source code from github: `git clone https://github.com/fetchai/colearn.git && cd colearn`. Create and launch a clean virtual environment with Python 3.7 and install the package from source by running `pip install -e .[all]`. Finally, run one of the examples with `python colearn_examples/ml_interface/pytorch_mnist.py`.

interactions.input: What is the command to run the tests?
interactions.response: The command to run the tests is `tox`.

responses:
To install colearn from source, you will need to have git, autoconf, build-essential, cmake, erlang, libsodium-dev, and libgmp-dev installed on your machine. You can install these dependencies by running the appropriate command for your operating system. Once the dependencies are installed, you can clone the colearn repository from GitHub and install the package from source. To do this, run the following commands: 

git clone https://github.com/fetchai/colearn.git && cd colearn
pip install -e .[all]

Once the installation is complete, you can run the examples by running the command: 

python -m colearn_examples.ml_interface.run_demo

To run the tests for colearn from source, you can use the command 'tox' in the build folder. This will run all the tests for the colearn library. You can also use the 'isoltest' tool to run syntax tests, which are stored in the tests/libsolidity/syntaxTests folder.
